ygData.subject: The Zardus Communication

Subject: The Zardus Communication
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com

--part1_cf.368567a.27dce03f_boundary
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

       The Onyx cruised silently from its position. The Ambassador had 
remained in a vigil over the battles for the past few weeks. Her task couldnt 
be sabotaged by a misguided missle or stray autogun blast. That would have 
caused a number of complications.
       Mortem was a femm bot through and through. She was trained in level 4 
armed forces combat training and protocol. As the Predacon Ambassador she was 
required to know self defense as well as how to take an opponent down, if 
needed. 
       Earth shown back at her brightly, with blue, green, and brown 
reflections playing across the face of the black warship. She had never 
encountered a fully biological plain such as this one. All of her dealings 
had been done on cold metallic worlds where the artificial air had been 
recirculated so many times it gave off the distinct smell of Ozone. This was 
going to be a welcomed experience for her.
       "Tal-X, set a landing course. Preferably by the Allience Fortress. Our 
Intelligence says that the commander of this faction inparticular is the 
strongest." She said in a voice clearly trained in the art of negotion and 
dealings.
       The computer responded. "Affirmative Ambassador. I will open a 
communication channle to them to let them know of the arrival of the Onyx." 
The computer was a vast resource of Artificial Intelligence built by the 
Predacon Government especially for this mission.
       When the channle was open, Mortem began reverently. "Hail Commander 
Zardus of the Allience. On behalf of the Predacon Republic of Cybertron I am 
Ambassador Mortem. If possible I wish to hold audience with you, and seek 
landing within the safety of your Island. My ship and resources will be at 
your disposal as you see fit while I stay with you. I shall wait for your 
response Commander."
       She looked away from the screen and turned to the blue electric face 
of Tal-X who occupied a long cylinder in the middle of the Command Bridge of 
this large ship. "Ambassador, the background on Zardus, should it prove the 
price we paid for it, shows that he is an agressive yet smart individual. I 
expect a quick and polite response."
       She nodded. After all, her mission was to locate the whereabout of 
some of the most wanted bots in the galaxy. Zardus, with his army and 
resources, would greatly narrow the search down. And the Predacons of this 
planet seemd to be in the midst of a Civil War, one which she could never 
allign herself with. 
       "Let us hope for the best, Tal. If he refuses then this mission is 
going to become alot more difficult, and I fear that it will become much more 
deadly." She said and returned her gaze to the green planet ahead of them.

--part1_cf.368567a.27dce03f_boundary
